    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkLookAroundUsed()
      This method checks the boolean value to determine if the lookaround ability is already used or not, the look around ability is only available to the player once per turn.
      void debugActivate()
      This method calls the debug mode method from the game engine
      void debugCheck()
      This method just enables the debug mode.
      void doIWinYet()
      This method checks if the game is won or not, it is called in options methods, and if the game is won, the player is redirected to the main menu.
      void FirstMenu()
      This is the first menu the User encounters when the game is launched this method contains the takes the input from the user and sends the input to the FirstMenuRedirection method.
      void FirstMenuRedirection(int userChoice)
      This method takes in the user's choice and opens the appropriate method
      void loadGame(java.lang.String fileName)
      The loadGame method loads allows the user to load a previously saved game into memory, what it actually does is load the game engine object from file and load it to memory.
      void lookAroundUsed()
      This method is called once the player has used the look around ability once per turn, then it doesn't allow the player to use it again.
      void makeAListofSaves(java.lang.String FileName)
      This method makes/edits a file called ".savedata" and makes a list of save games in there.
      void options()
      This method does calls on multiple other methods to check if the game is won, if the debug mode is enabled, if the player is inviniclbe this method also prints out the grid, it also takes the input from the user and does the appropriate action.
      void playerShoot()
      this method asks the user which direction to shoot then calls the shoot method in the game engine.
      void playerStatus()
      This method shows the amount of lives left and prints it on the screen, the lives are shown by called the lives method in from the game engine.
      void printGrid()
      This method is used to print the grid out to the user in a form of readable strings.
      void printLogo()
      printLogo method is just used to make the UI a bit more snazzy, it prints out an ascii logo from a file when the game is started.
      void printTheListofSaves()
      This method opens the ".savedata" file and prints out the list of save files from there to the screen, so the user can use it to type the load files name from here.
      void resetLookAroundUsed()
      This method resets the boolean value to false when the player's turn is started, so that the player can use the look around ability.
      void saveGame(java.lang.String fileName)
      this method allows the user to save the game.
      void wantedToSee()
      This method asks for user input and then reveals one additional block depending on the direction the user inputs.

    • Method Detail

      • FirstMenu

        public void FirstMenu()
        This is the first menu the User encounters when the game is launched this method contains the takes the input from the user and sends the input to the FirstMenuRedirection method.

      • FirstMenuRedirection

        public void FirstMenuRedirection(int userChoice)
        This method takes in the user's choice and opens the appropriate method
        Parameters:
        userChoice - the user input taken in from the FirstMenu method

      • options

        public void options()
        This method does calls on multiple other methods to check if the game is won, if the debug mode is enabled, if the player is inviniclbe this method also prints out the grid, it also takes the input from the user and does the appropriate action. We incorporated recursion into this method, but since it barely uses any memory, it should not cause any errors.

      • playerShoot

        public void playerShoot()
        this method asks the user which direction to shoot then calls the shoot method in the game engine.

      • playerStatus

        public void playerStatus()
        This method shows the amount of lives left and prints it on the screen, the lives are shown by called the lives method in from the game engine.

      • doIWinYet

        public void doIWinYet()
        This method checks if the game is won or not, it is called in options methods, and if the game is won, the player is redirected to the main menu.

      • lookAroundUsed

        public void lookAroundUsed()
        This method is called once the player has used the look around ability once per turn, then it doesn't allow the player to use it again.

      • resetLookAroundUsed

        public void resetLookAroundUsed()
        This method resets the boolean value to false when the player's turn is started, so that the player can use the look around ability.

      • checkLookAroundUsed

        public void checkLookAroundUsed()
        This method checks the boolean value to determine if the lookaround ability is already used or not, the look around ability is only available to the player once per turn.

      • makeAListofSaves

        public void makeAListofSaves(java.lang.String FileName)
        This method makes/edits a file called ".savedata" and makes a list of save games in there.
        Parameters:
        FileName -

      • printTheListofSaves

        public void printTheListofSaves()
        This method opens the ".savedata" file and prints out the list of save files from there to the screen, so the user can use it to type the load files name from here.

      • wantedToSee

        public void wantedToSee()
        This method asks for user input and then reveals one additional block depending on the direction the user inputs.

      • debugCheck

        public void debugCheck()
        This method just enables the debug mode.

      • debugActivate

        public void debugActivate()
        This method calls the debug mode method from the game engine

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame(java.lang.String fileName)
        this method allows the user to save the game. the method saves the game engine object into a binary file and catches exceptions and prints out an error.
        Parameters:
        fileName -

      • loadGame

        public void loadGame(java.lang.String fileName)
        The loadGame method loads allows the user to load a previously saved game into memory, what it actually does is load the game engine object from file and load it to memory.
        Parameters:
        fileName -

      • printGrid

        public void printGrid()
        This method is used to print the grid out to the user in a form of readable strings. It uses toString methods from the individual objects in the grid to print out their specific icon.

      • printLogo

        public void printLogo()
        printLogo method is just used to make the UI a bit more snazzy, it prints out an ascii logo from a file when the game is started.
